wikipedia_page.main: Robert Alderson Wright, Baron Wright,  (15 October 1869 – 27 June 1964) was a British judge. A commercial barrister, he was a Justice of the High Court from 1925 to 1932, when he was directly promoted to the House of Lords as a law lord. Robert Stevens described him as "one of the few significant British appeal judges of the twentieth century."

response: *Robert Wright, Baron Wright (1869–1964), British law lord
